Open Diversity Project

IT development, training, programs and career guidance initiatives for minority groups.

The Introduction to web development technologies project

22 Sep 2018 by Shawn Sandy

  • Project Map
    • Getting Started
      • About the track
        • This track will introduce Participants to the technologies behind website development while building one of their own, from domain registration to development and from development to deployment. By the end of this course participants will be able to build, deploy and manage a basic website.
        • Participants will also participate in a challenge project that allows them to put their knowledge in a
      • Requirements for this track
        • Email account
        • Internet Access
        • Computer with audio (video optional) chat capabilities
        • 2-4 hrs a week for course
        • Join free code camp and provide a link to their BIO page so mentors can track their progress for related course work
        • Be willing to help others participants and share their experience
        • Volunteer on the project
      • Tools and Resources you need
        • Slack - Join the open diversity channel on slack - https://opendiversityproject.slack.com/
        • GitHub - Create a github account https://github.com
    • Web Development
      • Development I - Your first website
        • What are Domains and why do you need one
        • Web Servers
      • Development II - Making it yours
      • Development III - Adding interactivity and feedback
    • Web Design Introduction
      • Coming soon
    • Websites management, marketing & security
      • Coming soon
  • Course Work
  • Project Challenge.
